title: Chihuahuan Desert Regeneration Parameters
description: Parameter set for REGv1 solver calibrated to arid/semi-arid desert vegetation-SOM-moisture feedbacks

r_V.description: Vegetation intrinsic growth rate (slower than Loess Plateau)

K_V.description: Vegetation carrying capacity (lower than mesic sites)
K_V.note: Water limitation reduces maximum achievable cover

lambda1.note: Strong moisture limitation makes vegetation highly responsive to water availability

lambda2.note: Higher sensitivity to SOM in arid systems (larger marginal benefit)

theta_star.description: Critical soil moisture threshold (lower in arid systems)
theta_star.note: Adapted vegetation with lower moisture requirements

SOM_star.description: Critical SOM threshold for positive feedback lock-in
SOM_star.note: Lower baseline SOM in arid systems

a1.description: SOM input rate per unit vegetation cover
a1.note: Lower primary productivity in arid systems; but long-term desert restoration shows large SOM increases (10-40× after 30 yr)

a2.description: SOM decomposition/decay rate (slower in arid conditions)
a2.note: Lower microbial activity and slower decomposition in water-limited environments

eta1.description: Water holding capacity gain per % SOM increase
eta1.note: Arid soils often show strong SOM→infiltration gains (higher marginal benefit)

K_vertical_multiplier.description: Compounding multiplier for vertical conductivity per % SOM increase
K_vertical_multiplier.note: Same structural relationship as Loess Plateau

dt_typical.description: Typical timestep for regeneration cascade solver (slow timescale)

call_frequency.description: REGv1 called once every 128 HYD-RLv1 steps

desert_restoration_sanity_check.description: 30-year simulation from bare desert to restored grassland

expected_final_state.trajectory: Slower sigmoid with longer time constants than Loess Plateau

references.pqac-00000000: Desert restoration SOM increases (10-40× after 30 yr)
references.note: Use cautiously as upper bounds when extrapolating to semi-arid sites
